elements.title: Daddy, what did you do in the Great War? (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some British soldiers hung the First World War propaganda poster "Daddy, what did you do in the Great War?" in the trenches and left sarcastic answers to the daughter's question?

elements.title: Mosaic of Rehob (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Mosaic of Rehob is the oldest surviving Talmudic text?

elements.title: 2022 New York City Marathon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the men's winner of the 2022 New York City Marathon was almost hit by a vehicle during the race?

elements.title: Rhina Aguirre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after losing her eyesight to toxoplasmosis, Rhina Aguirre dedicated herself to disability rights and was elected to the Bolivian Senate in 2009?

elements.title: Arlington House, Margate (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that you can see the sea from every apartment in Arlington House, Margate?

elements.title: William Y. Slack (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 161 years ago today, William Y. Slack was promoted to brigadier general, even though he was already dead?

elements.title: Sasajiscymnus tsugae (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sasajiscymnus tsugae is used as a biological control method for the hemlock woolly adelgid, an invasive pest of the eastern hemlock?

elements.title: a giant cat picture (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Museum Arnhem in the Netherlands celebrated its 100th anniversary with a giant cat picture?
